jobDescription: For Current Kite Pharma Employees and Contractors:Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this jobJob DescriptionWe are seeking a highly motivated individual with immunology and/or oncology experience to work on innovative T cell therapies for cancer treatment. The successful candidate will play an integral role as a key team member of the Pharmacology group, focused on the development and in vivo characterization of Kite’s autologous T cell products. Under minimal supervision, you will be expected to perform experiments, organize and analyze results, and communicate and present findings in team meetings. You will also be asked to perform other duties as required. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Independently interact with Contract Research Organizations (CROs) to support in vivo studies related to the development of cancer immunotherapy productsWork with a cross-functional research team to advance the development of autologous T cell therapy products and provide input into project directionIndependently plan experiments and interpret data as required for projectSuccessfully execute and document laboratory procedures and experiments with great attention to detailOther duties as assignedRequirements:Ph.D. degree in immunology or a closely-related field with 3 years of relevant post-doctoral laboratory experience in cellular and/or tumor immunology (industry experience preferred)Knowledge of T-cell trafficking to the tumor microenvironment in vivo is preferredPrior experience of managing/mentoring research associate level staffPrior experience of culturing primary human T cells and cell linesExperience with retroviral and/or lentiviral transduction of primary cellsProficiency in the in vitro analysis of immune cells, including multi-parameter flow cytometry, Luminex® assays and qPCRKnowledge of relevant emerging technologies, for example, Droplet DigitalTM PCRSelf-motivated and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job descriptionAbility to work in a highly collaborative environmentAbility to think critically, and demonstrated troubleshooting and problem solving skillsStrong organizational and record-keeping skillsExcellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skillsComfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities Kite is a biopharmaceutical company engaged in the development of innovative cancer immunotherapies with a goal of providing rapid, long-term durable response and eliminating the burden of chronic care. The company is focused on chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) and T cell receptor (TCR) engineered cell therapies designed to empower the immune system's ability to recognize and kill tumors. Kite is based in Santa Monica, CA. For more information on Kite, please visit www.kitepharma.com.
